headline: Broadcom Shares Jump Friday Morning After a Week of Booming Capex Plans
summary: Amazon (Nasdaq: AMZN) announced earnings last night and Wall Street’s focused on one single number: $200 billion in capital expenditure guidance for 2026. It’s just the latest in companies announcing plans of stunning size. Earlier this week, Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOGL) announced capital expenditure guidance of $175-$185 billion for 2026, dwarfing Meta Platforms (NASDAQ:META)’s $135 billion commitment. ... headline: Wall Street bounces back as tech stocks recover and bitcoin stops plunging
summary: Wall Street is bouncing back from big losses taken earlier in the week, as technology stocks recover some of their losses on Friday and bitcoin halts its plunge, at least for now.  The S&P 500 rose 0.9% and was heading for just its second gain in the last eight days.  Chip companies helped drive the gains, and Nvidia rallied 4.9% to trim its loss for the week, which came into the day at just over 10%.

content.title: Wall Street bounces back as tech stocks recover and bitcoin stops plunging

Chip companies helped drive the gains, and Nvidia rallied 4.9% to trim its loss for the week, which came into the day at just over 10%.

headline: Wall Street Analysts Think Broadcom Inc. (AVGO) Is a Good Investment: Is It?

Stocks of smaller U.S. companies also helped lead the market, along with companies whose profits depend on U.S. households spending more money.

headline: Nvidia Shares Surge on Big Tech’s $650 Billion AI-Spending Plan
summary: Shares of the chipmaker rose as much as 7.7%, the biggest intraday jump since April 9, adding more than $300 billion in market value.  Amazon.com Inc. sparked the rebound after the technology giant said during an earnings call that it plans to spend $200 billion on data centers, chips and other equipment this year.  All told, Amazon, along with Alphabet Inc., Meta Platforms Inc. and Microsoft Corp., are expected to shell out roughly $650 billion for AI tools in 2026, about 60% more than the prior year.

content.title: Nvidia Shares Surge on Big Tech’s $650 Billion AI-Spending Plan
content.summary: Shares of the chipmaker rose as much as 7.7%, the biggest intraday jump since April 9, adding more than $300 billion in market value.  Amazon.com Inc. sparked the rebound after the technology giant said during an earnings call that it plans to spend $200 billion on data centers, chips and other equipment this year.  All told, Amazon, along with Alphabet Inc., Meta Platforms Inc. and Microsoft Corp., are expected to shell out roughly $650 billion for AI tools in 2026, about 60% more than the prior year.

headline: US stocks soar to their best day since May as the Dow tops 50,000 and bitcoin stops plunging
summary: The U.S. stock market roared back on Friday, as technology stocks recovered much of their losses from earlier in the week and bitcoin halted its plunge, at least for now.  Stocks of smaller U.S. companies also helped lead the market, along with companies whose profits depend on U.S. households spending more money.

Stocks of smaller U.S. companies also helped lead the market, along with companies whose profits depend on U.S. households spending more money.

thumbnail.caption: Trader Joel Lucchese, right, and colleagues wear "DOW 50,000" caps on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange as the Dow Jones industrial average intra-day number topped the 50,000 level for the first time, Friday, Feb. 6, 2026. (AP Photo/Richard Drew)
